title: House Democrats Release Trump's Alleged Epstein Birthday Message Photo
snippets: Democrats on the House Oversight Committee said the book included a tawdry drawing and note that appeared to include President Trump's signature. Trump had previously denied its existence.
The White House says the president did not draw the picture or sign the note, after it was published on Monday.
After the letter was first reported by the WSJ, Trump denied he had written such a note and later sued for $10bn.

<a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMihwFBVV95cUxQNGp4U3EwY3A3VkdiaVUySWxidmFHeEtHcGFzNW5DWGVERUpuc2RPNGxFeEtGX3BpVkVIM182d1hwcWJZeVJlclZLV29nSUQyWE5WVkR1Ny1mRlhfM243X2ZhMVdTZWlab1hqNDNxRXBVTkhLMGEyWFlfMkZvblZGUTd5T2dILW8?oc=5" target="_blank">Trump's alleged drawing in Epstein birthday
The committee issued a subpoena in late August for information from the estate.
President Donald Trump sued The Wall Street Journal for defamation over its report revealing the existence of the letter to Jeffrey Epstein.

Trump’s press secretary claims image released by Democrats on the House Oversight Committee proves US president did not draw picture or sign it

  • House Democrats share screenshot of apparent Trump

Screenshot mirrors description of letter, first revealed by WSJ and turned over by estate lawyers after subpoena

  • US politics live – latest updates
A photo allegedly showing a birthday message to Jeffrey Epstein allegedly signed by Donald Trump was published by House Democrats and the Wall Street Journal.
titles: Estate of Jeffrey Epstein gives Congress 'birthday book' allegedly signed by Trump
Democrats in Congress release alleged Trump birthday note to Epstein
Trump’s alleged, suggestive birthday note to Epstein released by Democrats
Trump's alleged drawing in Epstein birthday book released by House Democrats - Axios

House Democrats share image of apparent Trump birthday note to Epstein
Photo Allegedly Showing Birthday Message To Epstein Signed By Trump Given To Congress
summary: Democrats on the House Oversight Committee published a photo of a birthday message allegedly signed by Donald Trump to Jeffrey Epstein, which Trump had previously denied existed. The White House and Trump's press secretary claim he did not create or sign the drawing. Following the Wall Street Journal's report on the letter, Trump sued the publication for $10 billion for defamation. The image was released after a subpoena was issued for information from Epstein's estate.

title: France's Government Falls as PM Bayrou Ousted in Confidence Vote
snippets: Legislators toppled France's government in a confidence vote, a new crisis for Europe's second-largest economy. Prime Minister François Bayrou was ousted overwhelmingly in a 364-194 vote against him.
French Parliament votes to bring down the Bayrou-led government over its plans to cut about $52bn to reduce the debt.
France is set to lose its third premier in 12 months. Pressure is now mounting on President Emmanuel Macron to pick a new prime minister after Francois Bayrou's resignation.
President Emmanuel Macron will look for a replacement who can break the budget impasse

Government collapses after Emmanuel Macron’s ally wins support of just 194 MPs with 364 against

François Bayrou has been ousted in a confidence vote after
Prime Minister François Bayrou failed a confidence vote aimed at breaking an impasse over the budget, adding more pressure on President Emmanuel Macron.
titles: France's government collapses after the prime minister loses a confidence vote
French government collapses after PM Bayrou ousted in confidence vote
France: Prime Minister Bayrou ousted in confidence vote
French government collapses as PM François Bayrou loses confidence vote
François Bayrou ousted as French PM after losing confidence vote
French Prime Minister Bayrou Loses Confidence Vote, Putting Pressure on Macron
summary: France's government fell after a confidence vote ousted Prime Minister François Bayrou with a 364-194 result. The vote was a response to Bayrou's controversial plans to cut $52bn in spending to reduce national debt. This marks the third prime ministerial departure in France within a year, putting President Emmanuel Macron under pressure to find a successor capable of resolving the budget deadlock.

title: Lachlan Murdoch to Lead Murdoch Empire, Resolving Family Dispute
snippets: Lachlan Murdoch will retain control the conservative Fox and News Corp empire under the deal.
Lachlan takes control as three siblings receive $1.1bn each to settle long-running family feud

Family announces Rupert Murdoch’s eldest son, Lachlan Murdoch, will secure control of business

The succession battle at Rupert Murdoch’s media empire has ended.

The family announced on Monday that Lachlan Murdoch, Murdoch’s eldest son, will secure control of the Murdochs’ sprawling me
Rupert Murdoch and his children have reached an agreement over what will become of his media empire. It will see heir apparent Lachlan Murdoch reign.
The dispute over the Murdoch’s family trust intensified last year, with family patriarch and billionaire Rupert Murdoch seeking to give control to Lachlan, his eldest son.
The future of Fox News and The Wall Street Journal were at stake.
titles: Murdochs reach deal in succession battle over media empire
Murdoch seals $3.3bn succession deal to hand empire to eldest son
Murdoch family reaches deal to resolve succession fight over media empire
The real-life 'Succession' fight for control of the Murdoch media empire has come to an end

Rupert Murdoch’s real-life ‘Succession’ battle just ended in a multibillion-dollar deal that keeps Fox News, Wall Street Journal conservative
summary: Lachlan Murdoch will take control of the Murdoch media empire, including Fox News and The Wall Street Journal, following a family agreement. This decision resolves a succession dispute, with Lachlan's siblings receiving $1.1 billion each.

title: Murdoch Family Resolves Dispute Over Media Empire's Future Control
snippets: The owner of Fox News, the Wall Street Journal and dozens of other media properties has settled a legal fight with three of his own children over who would control his companies after his death.
Rupert Murdoch’s family has reached a deal on control of his media empire after his death

Rupert Murdoch’s family has reached a deal on control of the 94-year-old mogul’s media empire after his death, ensuring no change in direction at Fox News, the most popular network for President Donald Trump and conservatives. The deal creates a trust establishing control of the Fox Corp

Rupert Murdoch’s family has reached a deal on control of the 94-year-old mogul’s media empire after his death, ensuring no change in direction at Fox News, the most popular network for President Donald Trump and conservatives. The deal creates a trust establishing control of the Fox Corp. for Lachla
titles: Rupert Murdoch buys out 3 of his children to seal fate of his media empire
Rupert Murdoch's family reaches deal on who will control media empire after his death
Rupert Murdoch’s family reaches deal on who will control media empire after his death
Rupert Murdoch’s family reaches deal on who will control media empire after his death
summary: Rupert Murdoch and his children have settled a dispute over the future control of his media empire, including Fox News and the Wall Street Journal, after his death. A trust has been established to ensure continuity in the direction of the companies, with no expected changes at Fox News, a key outlet for conservative audiences. This agreement resolves internal family legal battles over Murdoch's assets.

title: Jerusalem Shooting: 5 Dead, 12 Injured in Attack at Bus Stop
snippets: Hamas hailed the attack without claiming responsibility, calling it a "natural response to the occupation's crimes against our people."
Six people were killed in a shooting attack by suspected Palestinian gunmen at a bus stop in occupied East Jerusalem.

At least 12 others injured in attack at Ramot intersection during morning rush hour

Palestinian gunmen opened fire at a crowded bus stop in the northern outskirts of Jerusalem on Monday, killing six people and injuring 12 others before being shot dead by an off-duty soldier and a civilian a
Israeli authorities identified the two gunmen, who were killed at the scene, as Palestinians from the West Bank.
The Israeli police described the shooting as a terrorist attack and said that the perpetrators had been killed at the scene.
titles: Palestinian gunmen kill 6 people in attack on Jerusalem bus stop
Suspected Palestinian gunmen kill six people in East Jerusalem
Palestinian gunmen kill six people at Jerusalem bus stop
Gunmen kill 6 in shooting attack at Jerusalem bus stop, police say
Gunmen Attack Bus Stop in Jerusalem, Killing at Least 6
summary: In Jerusalem, a shooting at a bus stop by two Palestinian attackers from the West Bank resulted in at least five deaths and 12 injuries, with six in serious condition. The incident, occurring during the morning rush hour, is among the deadliest in the city in recent years. Israeli police and civilians at the scene responded, killing the two gunmen. Authorities are treating the event as a terrorist attack.

summary: Nottingham Forest has dismissed head coach Nuno Espirito Santo after 20 months, despite him recently securing the team's place in the Europa League and receiving a new contract in June. The decision follows reported tensions between Nuno and the club's owner.

title: Meta Accused by Whistleblowers of Hiding VR Harm to Children
snippets:
Company accused of manipulating virtual reality research as congresswoman attacks Meta’s ‘disgusting web of lies’

A group of six whistleblowers have come forward with allegations of a cover-up of harm to children on Meta’s virtual reality devices and apps. They say the social media company,

A new group of whistleblowers are coming forward to allege that Meta is restricting research into how its virtual reality offerings could negatively impact kids and teens, The Washington Post reports. Four current and former Meta staffers allege that after an earlier whistleblower, Frances Haugen, l
Four whistleblowers share documents with Congress alleging that the company may have suppressed research on children's safety.
titles: Meta hid harms to children from VR products, whistleblowers allege
Meta curbed research about VR safety risks to kids, whistleblowers say
Meta suppressed children’s safety research, 4 whistleblowers claim
summary: Six whistleblowers have accused Meta of manipulating research and covering up potential harm to children caused by its virtual reality devices and apps. These allegations include restricting investigations into the negative impacts on minors and suppressing safety research. The issue has drawn criticism from a congresswoman and has led to the sharing of documents with Congress to support these claims.

title: Nepal Protests: 19 Dead as Citizens Rally Against Corruption, Social Media Ban
snippets:
Many demonstrators say they are also on the streets over corruption and nepotism they allege is rampant

At least 19 people have been killed during protests in Nepal over a government ban on dozens of online platforms including Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp and X.

The government has f
The demonstrations in Nepal over government corruption and restrictions to apps such as WhatsApp and Facebook were driven by widespread anger among young people.
The government retreated from the ban amid anger over violent dispersal of demonstrators protesting graft, inequality and social media controls.
titles: At least 19 killed in ‘gen Z’ protests against Nepal’s social media ban
At least 19 killed, hundreds injured in protests after Nepal social media ban
19 Killed in Nepal ‘Gen Z’ Protests Over Social Media Ban and Corruption
summary: In Nepal, protests erupted against government corruption and the ban of major social media platforms, including Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp, and X. Demonstrators, demanding the lifting of the ban and addressing corruption, clashed with police who used water cannons, batons, and rubber bullets. The unrest led to at least 19 deaths and over 200 injuries. Protesters also stormed the Parliament complex, highlighting widespread frustration with nepotism and governance issues.

title: Manchester City, Premier League Settle Dispute Over Sponsorship Rules

• Dispute over associated party transaction rules ends

  • Club still face charges of breaching financial rules

Manchester City and the Premier League have settled their dispute over rules that limit the ability of top-flight clubs to sign sponsorship deals with c
Manchester City and the Premier League have reached a settlement in their dispute over the rules governing Associated Party Transactions (APTs).
titles: Man City & Premier League end sponsor rules dispute
Manchester City settle with Premier League and accept sponsorship rules are valid
Man City and Premier League settle dispute over APT rules
summary: Manchester City and the Premier League have settled a dispute regarding Associated Party Transactions rules, which limit clubs' sponsorship deal capabilities. While this specific disagreement has been resolved, Manchester City still faces charges related to breaching other financial regulations, with the outcome of those charges still pending.

title: Israel Orders Gaza Evacuations Amid Airstrikes; 6 Killed in Jerusalem Shooting
snippets: Gaza City residents told to 'leave now', while UN human rights chief condemns Israel for 'war crime upon war crime'.

Israel told Gaza City residents to evacuate immediately, warning of intensified airstrikes and expanded ground operations. Meanwhile six people were killed in a shooting at a Jerusalem bus stop. Follow DW for more.
titles: Netanyahu threatens Gaza residents as UN slams Israel over ‘mass killing’
Israel's Netanyahu warns Gaza City residents to 'leave now'
summary: Israel has instructed Gaza City residents to evacuate immediately due to plans for intensified airstrikes and expanded ground operations. Concurrently, a shooting at a Jerusalem bus stop resulted in six fatalities. The UN human rights chief has condemned Israel, accusing it of committing "war crime upon war crime."

summary: U.S. Senator Richard Blumenthal warned the WNBA in a letter to not interfere with negotiations between the Mohegan tribe and potential new owners for the Connecticut Sun. This adds tension to the ongoing stalemate regarding the team's ownership.

San Francisco 49ers star tight end George Kittle will miss at least a few weeks with a hamstring injury and quarterback Brock Purdy's status for this week is in question after he hurt his left shoulder and toe in the season opener. The team has not yet made a decision on Purdy's status for the next game.

Howard didn't pull any punches when describing his former quarterback

summary: Former Dolphins, now Colts cornerback Xavien Howard, revealed their strategy against QB Tua Tagovailoa in Sunday's game was to eliminate his first read option, aiming to induce panic. Howard spoke candidly about his former teammate's performance.

title: Erin Patterson Gets Life for Murdering 3 Relatives with Poisonous Mushrooms
snippets: Erin Patterson was convicted of killing three relatives with a lunch laced with death cap mushrooms. The judge called her actions “an enormous betrayal of trust.”
Erin Patterson was found guilty of murdering three of her husband’s relatives and trying to kill a fourth by serving them deadly mushrooms.

A Victorian supreme court judge has sentenced Erin Patterson to life imprisonment with a non-parole period of 33 years. A jury had previously found Patterson guilty of three counts of murder and one count of attempted murder by serving beef wellingtons laced with deadly death cap mushrooms. She h

Erin Patterson has been sentenced to life in prison with a non-parole period of 33 years after murdering three people and attempting to murder a fourth with a lunch laced with death cap mushrooms. Patterson, 50, was found guilty of murdering Don and Gail Patterson – the parents of her estranged h
titles: Australian woman gets life in prison for ‘mushroom murders’
Australian Woman, Erin Patterson, Gets Life in Mushroom Murder Case
Watch in full: Erin Patterson sentenced to life in prison for Australian mushroom murders – video
Erin Patterson: Australia's mushroom murderer sentenced to life in prison – video
summary: Erin Patterson was sentenced to life in prison with a minimum non-parole period of 33 years by an Australian court for murdering three of her estranged husband's relatives and attempting to murder a fourth by serving them a meal containing death cap mushrooms. The judge noted Patterson showed no remorse for her actions, which were described as a significant betrayal of trust.

title: 2025 MTV VMAs Hit Six-Year Viewership Peak with 5.5 Million Tuning In
snippets: The 2025 "MTV Video Music Awards" (VMAs) delivered 5.5 million viewers, which marked a six-year audience high for the annual telecast.
One of MTV's most popular programs, the VMAs, aired on … CBS, Paramount's broadcast network. Does that make sense? Sure. Here's why.
titles: MTV Video Music Awards Hit Six-Year Audience High
It makes sense that MTV's Video Music Awards aired on CBS
summary: The 2025 MTV Video Music Awards attracted 5.5 million viewers, reaching a six-year high for the annual show. It was broadcast on CBS, a network owned by Paramount, indicating a strategic choice given its popularity.

title: Google Admits "Rapid Decline" of Open Web, Contradicting Earlier Claims
snippets: For months, Google has maintained that the web is “thriving,” AI isn’t tanking traffic, and its search engine is sending people to a wider variety of websites than ever. But in a court filing from last week, Google admitted that “the open web is already in rapid decline,” as spotted earlier by Jason
Google's position on the state of the Internet is murky to say the least.
titles: Google admits the open web is in ‘rapid decline’
In court filing, Google concedes the open web is in “rapid decline”
summary: Google, previously claiming the web is "thriving" and its search engine promotes diversity, contradicted itself in a recent court filing, acknowledging the "rapid decline" of the open web. This marks a significant shift in the company's public stance on the internet's health and the effects of AI on web traffic.

title: 475 Arrested in Raid at Hyundai Site in Georgia, South Korea Expresses Concerns
snippets: Federal and immigration agents conducted a massive raid on a Hyundai facility in Ellabell, Georgia, last week, arresting 475 people.
South Korea pledged to invest $350 billion in the U.S. in a trade deal. Now the country is reeling at actions many see as counter to the spirit of the alliance.
titles: What to know about the Hyundai-LG plant immigration raid in Georgia
Outrage, confusion in South Korea after Georgia immigration raid
summary: Federal and immigration agents arrested 475 people in a raid at a Hyundai facility in Ellabell, Georgia. Following the raid, South Korea, which had committed to investing $350 billion in the U.S. as part of a trade deal, expressed concerns that the action contradicted the spirit of the U.S.-South Korea alliance.
